website_summaries.verdict: One of the only industrial fan options that comes in a pack of two. Great for increasing airflow in larger rooms or multiple rooms at the same time.
pros: Comes with the necessary mounting brackets and wires and wall speed control unit to set up quickly without issue
cons: Extra weight of the fan can make it difficult to install without help

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fan for a Very Nice Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my garage. To make them hang at the correct height from a 9' ceiling, I cut the down rods short and drilled a few new holes. That worked like a charm. The fans move a lot of air and are quiet, except for the sound of the blades cutting through the air. I love the industrial look of these things. Both came with the huge fan speed controllers. I swapped those out for the normal size Westinghouse controllers available here on Amazon. Even with the added cost of the controller, this fan is a bargain. Highly recommended so far.
customer_reviews.author: S. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up over time.
customer_reviews.text: Not very good quality. I bought 2 of these and put them on a covered porch where they are totally protected from rain. The only exposure to moisture is humidity, which these are supposed to be designed to handle. They worked well for 2 summers but this summer (3 years from purchase date) they will not start and the insides are completely rusted out from just exposure to humidity. Live in North Carolina so it is fairly humid but I am shocked and disappointed that these fans aren't designed to hold up better than this!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Nowotny

customer_reviews.title: only rotate one direction. Potential problem.
customer_reviews.text: The fans are nice and move air, however they only turn one direction and no option to change. I mounted two of them in my barn with 20' ceilings. They push the hot air down from the metal roof. When standing under them (especially in the summer) its like a heater and its not warm air its hot. So they are useless in a shop or barn environment this time of year. I have asked electricians if I can change the rotation by adding a switch and they said its not possible. wish I would have noticed this before renting a lift and mounting them. my bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Terrible experience with remanufactured fan.
customer_reviews.text: Received the fan, was described as reconditioned, came in perfect packaging. The fan blades were completely MANGLED , bent out of shape, not at all balanced, all of the edges of the blades were bent so that they looked like they had been crimped. Looking past this experience, my husband and I have two of these same fans that were bought brand new and they look sharp, they nove a loy of air, and we love the switch settings.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Not happy about the required control unit
customer_reviews.text: Did not notice before ordering that the unit only has adjustment through a control know that needs placed between the switch and the fan. I ordered two of these, and the wiring was already in place and did not work for the set up. Each fan requires its own control knob so had to redo the electrical to get it to work with two fans. This is not like a ceiling fan you have in your bedroom with a little chain to control the speed settings. They wobble a bit, not too much. Air movement is adequate, but certainly was no clear about the wiring requirements for more than one fan.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Handsome Fan
customer_reviews.text: The fan is definitely handsome, but for my purposes, it's lacking. With only 3 blades, it just can't produce the air circulation of a strong fan. Sure, the switch is cool old-school and silly looking, but moreover, its 5 positions are redundant -- settings 1 or 2 produce no virtually no air movement, although I suppose some folks might like the ambiance of a slow-moving fan. At setting 5, it whirls pretty fast, but the three blades are limited. I even ordered a 24" extension and it barely made a dent. In a very small enclosed room it might be sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: zman

customer_reviews.title: They make a lot of noise but really don't move any air
customer_reviews.text: Spent 3 hours putting two of these up in my pole barn in place of my old warped wood blade fans. Now I know why they only draw 1.6 amps. They don't move any air. these things are spinning like crazy making all kinds of air noise but as I sit underneath that I would get more air off of a 8 inch fan
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Jay

customer_reviews.title: Buy another brand.
customer_reviews.text: I will tell you, no reverse switch, 2 sets of numbers. both do the same thing. I have a pole barn with 14 feet ceilings. I want the air to blow down so I can feel it. These fans only blow up. I can here them but there is no air movement below them. I have never owned a ceiling fan without a reverse switch. What a joke. I just paid an electrician $300.00 to install for no air movement.
customer_reviews.author: Electricgeek

customer_reviews.title: Great for garages.
customer_reviews.text: Installed 3 of these in my garage to keep air moving on those hot AZ summer days. I ended up cutting the rods down and drilling a new hole so they didn’t hang so low. I also threw away the clunky controls and added wireless remotes/controllers for each fan.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyjl

customer_reviews.title: A big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to install. What is the point of a fan that does not move a lot of air? I bought this fan specifically because it said it could move over 9000 CFM. I doubt if it does half of that on its highest setting. I followed the guidelines for the length of the downrod and the height of the ceiling etc
customer_reviews.author: G. Reon

customer_reviews.title: A super deal here
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value, super quiet, moves plenty of air on low speed in our 2400sf high ceiling shop (we installed 2). Got a Lutron TGFSQ-FH-WH Toggler Fan Speed Control at the advice of other amazons, (the included control unit is very bulky, won't fit in a standard single switch box, and is not reported to work well) and for under $100 delivered, we have a robust, attractive, and efficient air mover. Will buy more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: rojo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic fan
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in the center of my shop to push the hot air down from the ceiling. While it is a bit noisy while on high, it's a shop so it doesn't matter. I have found that if it's set on the lowest setting it moves the air enough that the heaters run a lot less and the entire shop is the same temperature. If on high it will move sawdust, paper, and plastic bags that are on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Helicopter Wind Machine
customer_reviews.text: These put out A LOT of breeze and have a really clean look.. On high setting, they sound like a MASH helicopter, but that is OK. The control box looks like it came from another era - so I just bought a good looking in-wall control switch at Lowes to match my style. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan. Moves air. Not loud.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Comes with down rod. Moves a lot of air. I can hear it when it is on high but it is not loud and does not disrupt a conversation. Best part is it makes a very nice breeze. Down side is the speed control is huge. You can connect to a single pole switch and it will run on high only, there is no pull chain, or install the bulky control and select from 5 speeds. I went with the bulky control.
customer_reviews.author: James F Hulse

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fan - Easy Install, Move Air Big Time
customer_reviews.text: Better use some extra hairspray around these fans - they move some air! Only negative is the wall switch is bulky and doesn’t match our switches - solved that by purchasing a Westinghouse fan wall switch - yes an added cost but these fans are competitively priced even with the purchase of the separate switch. Installed 2 of these fans - they look great and are a snap to install!
customer_reviews.author: Don Miller

customer_reviews.title: I bought this as used in good codition thru amazon
customer_reviews.text: First it blows very little air. I bought this as used in good codition thru amazon. two of three blades were bent and the lock knob to hold fan in place was broke and gone. i managed to straighten blades out and dont look to bad. I wonder what it takes to say not so good. I would not buy from them again, dont want to have to take it down and repack so ill just make do. a total waste of my money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: hardrich2001

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 56’ x 36’ x 16’ high
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful fans that I installed in a customers 56’ x 36’ pole shed. Put in 2 and they really move the air around with a 16’ ceiling. Not sure why only one fans allowed per control since on high they only draw 56 watts but they do include the controller super easy to install all together except the blades which have the blade support riveted and preinstalled perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Ostrowsky

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive fan!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these fans to use in my restaurant and am very happy with them. They look great, move a lot of air without generating turbulence and are whisper quiet. You can't get a better quality commercial grade fan at this price! I would happily use one at home, The brushed nickel finish and simplistic design give this fan a very elegant look.
customer_reviews.author: Luis R. Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Good all around except it doesn't move air where it should
customer_reviews.text: Good price, esay install, looks good but doesn't move air well directly below the fan where it's needed. I have four other fans that are also 3-blade and compared them by feel only and the Westinghouse doesn't move as much air. Also i cut down the rod by 6 1/2 inches. Easy to do. They should add a dollar to the price and provide a shorter rod.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Needs different style mount...
customer_reviews.text: Pictures in add are not of this fan. Fan delivered was stronger rated and different specs. The shape of the draft under the fan seems very narrow.my mount is extreamly firm but the hanger system has the fan hanging from a ball joint with no way to tighten down once the angle is achieved. The problem with this, is the fan will start to rotate inside of the hanger in the joint at speeds above 3. It also starts to make a blower style fan noise above 3 it does move ver fast. On 1 or 2 it is quiet and moves air well.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT fan for the money
customer_reviews.text: Installed this two weeks ago, it's one of the only metal fans of any quality at all on Amazon, and it's also one of the cheapest. Super easy to assemble, fewer parts than most fans. Downrod is too long in my case, but most people will be happy with it. Only con is that the controller box that you're supposed to use is atrociously large, and weighs several pounds. I swapped it out for a Z-wave wall fan controller and now have fine control over the speed, for less price than I would have paid for pretty much any 'smart' fan.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a stainless/brushed nickel and received a white fan instead. Decided to keep it since I didn't want the hassle of sending it back. Fan is shaky and makes noise....should've sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kaiya M.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, overall not great
customer_reviews.text: Looks great in my garage, but that’s where the pro’s end. Wobbles like crazy on medium speed, the remote is ridiculous (I ended up getting a wireless remote kit). Barely puts out any air because the blades don’t really have a pitch in them. Should have spent a little more and got a better one that actually works And cools as a garage ceiling fan
customer_reviews.author: Dave-D

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have it mounted outside in our gazebo. It looks really nice and it moves a decent amount of air on high. Not a ton of air but you can feel the breeze. The two issues I have are that it has a small wobble and I can’t seem to get it balanced. Also the motor gets VERY HOT. So hot you can’t even touch it after shutting it off. It was cheap so we’ll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: I'm Not A Fan
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these fans for the garage. We were excited to find an industrial style fan at such a good price. Unfortunately they don't move much, if any, more air than the $60 fans from Lowe's we have inside the house. Very disappointed! We will keep them this season because we have invested in the fans and the cost of installation, but will probably end up buying better fans next year. Sadly, we will have spent more in the long run than if we had just bought a better model in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Metal, no fan reversal. Powerful air flow 5 speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Very stylish, but sharp blades. Mount high ceilings only. Very powerful. No winter, summer directional. Wall dial is a bit trying to fyi unless a handyman, however they have a chat or cLlin line for help. Took 25 minutes to get finished. It works very well. Will be great in the spring & summer as my living area is large.
customer_reviews.author: Tatt-Back

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FAN
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but good things to say about this fan. I installed it on our back porch where we had no air flow what so ever. Even when there was a nice breeze it was unpleasant to sit and enjoy the day. After installing this fan we are loving the difference in the air flow. Definitely worth the money. As far as esthetics go it is a nice looking fan with the brushed nickel blades. The blades are metal and well balanced, no fan wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and changed wall switch.
customer_reviews.text: It’s an Industrial fan meant for industrial use. However, it’s perfect for an industrial look inside your home. For in home use you will need to purchase a smaller wall switch. On the recommendation of a previous review I purchased Westinghouse Lighting 7787200 Ceiling Fan Wall Control. On the lowest setting it’s not noisy but it’s fast enough for us in order to move the room air around. It’s noticeably louder on the second setting. Anything above that it’s sounds like a helicopter is hovering somewhere close by. BUT it’s too high for us anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE A REMOTE TO CONTROL THIS FAN.
customer_reviews.text: WARNING!! This fan lasted only 6 months of light service and then locked up. I called the Westinghouse customer service for the warranty. They stated that since I used a universal remote control, it voided my warranty. You can only use the speed control provided with the fan. If you use anything else, it voids the warranty. Note that Amazon lists a different speed control to possibly buy with the fan. The description of this fan does not state that you cannot use a remote.
customer_reviews.author: john h.

customer_reviews.title: Does not move as much air as expected
customer_reviews.text: These fans are easy to install, however unless you are right under them you don't feel any air moving. We have installed 14 fans in our house, different types and brands. I got these cheap ones because it was only for our gym. I now wish I had spent the extra money and gotten different ones. I am back to using a ground lever fan to cool areas in the gym when I am work out. Would not recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Cabaleiro

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and functioning fan
customer_reviews.text: Great fan for $65! I put it on the porch. Doesn't get droopy like the plastic fantastic ones do in the south. The controller is HUGE and pretty ugly for my application (making the wife happy) so I got a Lutron 3 speed controller. If you just use a rheostat it will hum. But if I used it in the garage I would have kept the big 70s controller because it has 5 speeds forward and backward. Anyway. Really nice fan. Looks really good in person and moves a lot of air.
customer_reviews.author: YankeeAdam

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous gorgeous fan but I had to return it because I mistakenly purchased it not knowing it doesn’t come with lighting. I definitely need a light and the ceiling fan would be my only light source in my efficiency. I despise lamps because they get dusty and they’re just in the way
customer_reviews.author: Krissi Starr

customer_reviews.title: Not very fast.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hang, no big deal. I expected an "industrial" fan to spin faster tho. On the highest setting, its effects in my garage are almost unnoticeable unless you stand right under the fan. It's not a bad fan tho. It works, its just not as strong as I expected. Might be nice when it's 80°f outside, but not when it's 100°f.
customer_reviews.author: rahands

customer_reviews.title: Fan blades de-laminate after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe what I saw yesterday after 3 years of use, the blades are coming apart. The construction must be plastic laminate steel blades, and the plastic is peeling off. An absolute disappointment to make a fan blade like this for a commercial application.
customer_reviews.author: MrLittlejohn

customer_reviews.title: More speed does not mean more air flow...
customer_reviews.text: This is the fastest fan I've every seen. Unfortunately more speed doesn't mean more air flow. I'm surprised how little air flow it puts out for as fast as it goes. The speed with metal blades is almost seems dangerous. It's installed and I will keep it. But disappointed in the lack of air flow.
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: No air for you
customer_reviews.text: This is a quite running fan and it looks good to be that is were it stops. It moves almost no air you I have a 10" room fan that moves more air. There is little pitch in the blades and they will not move air without pitch. If you want a nice looking fan that runs quite and don't move any air this is the fan for you.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dean

customer_reviews.title: This is actually a great fan. 4 stars instead of 5
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a great fan. 4 stars instead of 5, simply because the control switch make it look like it is a reversible unit. It IS NOT REVERSIBLE. Still, a perfectly solid product with a solid mount. No wobble at all.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Westinghouse 7861400 Industrial 56-Inch Three-Blade Ceiling Fan
customer_reviews.text: Good Industrial Ceiling Fan. Excellent quality, heavy duty and reliable,easy-to-use made forever. Extremely easy to set-up. Excellent packaging and protection, with the good price tag Very happy with this purchase! I would definitely recommend to a friend without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Laczko Studio

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace one of my garage fans but this one does not move much air. Top speed is about 2/3 of my other fans and the blades a do not have much angle. Also the speed selector switch is about an inch taller than a standard electric box. Guess it would be sufficient for a small room.
customer_reviews.author: Blento

customer_reviews.title: Good Fan
customer_reviews.text: Great fan. As many have said the control unit is HUGE. It’s the size of a brick, so I bought a new one at Home Depot to replace it. I have the fan mounted outside on a covered porch in Louisiana so we shall see how it hold up to the humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT the CFM it states much lower disappointed when it came on 3950 cfm
customer_reviews.text: My local home store has some rated at 4950 cfm and i used them in my old garage, we recently moved and I have 15 ft tall ceiling in my new garage so I wanted a little more CFM so I bought these and when they arrived clearly states on side of box 3950 CFM 2000 less than I was expecting, it works but i am disappointed not what i wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Not a performer.
customer_reviews.text: Fan does not move amount of air it claims. I would estimate half. Typically, I leave detailed reviews but I'm so disappointed in this fan I'm not going to. Also, it's noisy so don't place it anywhere you want to carry on a conversation.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me! I did not have a use for the control switch, so don’t have any of the issues that some people have with it being big. Puts out a good bit of air, and is very nice in my garage. Seems well built. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Install was pretty easy as I've installed what seems like dozens of ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in my 30x30 shop to help move some air around in the summer. Install was pretty easy as I've installed what seems like dozens of ceiling fans over the years. The control does look like it's from the 70's but I don't care about looks. The controls are confusing and I'm still not sure if 1 or 5 is the fastest as I haven't played with it much because it's been to cold out. Overall, very nice product that sure seems to move a lot of air.
customer_reviews.author: Blazer

customer_reviews.title: Best fan for business it works and delivers more then exact
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of this fans for my business and they were easy to install and they workers great they helped my A/C a lot and they save me power because my A/C don't have to run all the day to keep the store cool I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Bishoy

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very nice trendy looking fan for our home! Hung it in our open-floor plan living room/kitchen. Bought the Westinghouse 77492, 24" Brushed Nickel Down-rod and it matched perfectly! Also bought the Westinghouse 77872, 4-Speed Wall Control since the other one was big and clunky BUT it's an industrial fan people and it needed and industrial control! It makes my stainless steel appliances POP! My husband installed it without any problems. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for hot days .
customer_reviews.text: Don’t think because it’s long bladed, shinny aluminum or sounds like a helicopter that it puts out lots of air .....NOT ! I could get a box fan from Walmart and hang it from the ceiling and get more air . Looks great .! Sounds great ! The end .
customer_reviews.author: William William

customer_reviews.title: Glad I called the electrician
customer_reviews.text: I love this fan. I am glad I had it professionally installed due to the wall control. I did not notice that when I bought it and I would have been completely lost trying to install it. Quiet and it makes A LOT of air move! Love it!!!! Need 2 more!
customer_reviews.author: Barb M.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, sleek
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, sleek, modern ceiling fan. It is a little loud on the highest setting & doesn't seem to provide much air movement for the speed. It's a bit disappointing in that regard. Loose papers do NOT blow around. It seems like there should be substantially more air circulation, given the fan's speed. I actually checked to make sure we didn't have it on the winter setting, but there isn't a winter setting.
customer_reviews.author: KBL

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good buy but with one problem
customer_reviews.text: This fan is fantastic. Metal blades and is quality all the way through is is well worth the 55$ or whatever is coasts my only complaint is the variable speed controller. It is huge yet too small to easily run the wires in it, also it is so large it doesn’t fit over a standard 2x3 wall box so it you mount it on exposed conduit like i did it looks like terrible. In hignsight I shoulda just ditched the controller and hooked to to a regular switch.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Throw wall controller away
customer_reviews.text: Step one : throw the controller in the trash with the rest of your junk from 1976. Step two: install fan and wire to normal switch on the wall. Yes, it will work No, you can't change the speed without the controller, but If you are installing this in your garage/shop you are going to use it on high anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Travis T.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fan
customer_reviews.text: Installed in my garage to help move air in winter and summer. I shortened the hanging rod to about 6" as I only have 9' ceilings against the advice of the instructions. Be careful if you do the same as these metal blades are sharp and you DO NOT want to get your fingers in them at high speed. The fan looks great and moves alot of air. Only reason for 4 starts is that I wish there was a way to reverse the direction of rotation. Only able to adjust speed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: Westinghouse does not provide product support for these fans.
customer_reviews.text: These fans look great and operate just fine, but know that Westinghouse does not provide product support. The metal blades are minimally designed (sufficient for their intended purpose) and bend easily. Westinghouse will not sell replacements (I asked). Wood or plastic blades might get dinged or scratched from an accidental bump. These will bend. And if you bend one, like I did, it's nearly impossible to get it back to where the fan is balanced. You have to throw the whole fan out and buy a new one. Or in my case, two new ones... I consider product support an important aspect of a purchase, which is why I'm giving these fans three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: No idea how this fan garnered so many good reviews. Even on high, Air movement is pitiful unless you are directly under the fan, makes more noise than wind. Ended up replacing it in disgust after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Too many negatives.
customer_reviews.text: Too many negatives to justify the price. Noise, wobble, ugly wall switch. Electrician tried to bypass the box using a dimmer on the existing switch but the "hum" just got louder. So disappointed! Would have sent it back if not for having to pay the electrician for what he had already done. Pay a little more and get a better fan.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: So far not a good experience with this fan
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how all these people did good reviews on this fan because so far my experience is terrible it is very loud not the best air movement and wobbles like no weather I’ve tried all of the fix is to balance the fan none have worked it flops all over the Ceiling
customer_reviews.author: David g

customer_reviews.title: On a 1-10 scale.... 6-7
customer_reviews.text: 1. It’s not a hurricane force wind fan! I was slightly disappointed with the amount of airflow. 2. Do yourself a favor and just buy a wireless remote for the fan. Saves time, wiring, and money.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Patio Fan
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that was a good price, but not cheaply made and this fan checked all those boxes. It's on our back patio and has done well. The control box it comes with is horrible and totally unnecessary, but other than that I have no complaints. Of note, we did have to shorten the shaft that attaches to the ceiling so the fan didn't hang so low.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Kipp

customer_reviews.title: Cool basic no- nonsense fan
customer_reviews.text: These fans are rad! All metal and very basic. We used two of 'em in a 1920s house turned into a tattoo shop and with the turquoise green wood floors, grey walls and ceilings, these still looked good in white. We almost rattle- canned 'em black, but decided not to- they looked good as is. Been well over a year now and they still work great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kevin Cox

customer_reviews.title: Good fan, lousy controls
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fan with one major drawback. No on off switch and no speed control built into the fan. Comes with a rheostat that you can wire in down stream or upstream, big, ugly box that is only able to control one fan if you believe the specifications. The fan draws very little, I would be happier if they simply put a switch on it, doubly so if the controller included could control more than one fan. There are electric motor speed controllers available that are much more powerful for a few bucks, I got one and made a decent looking mount for it.
customer_reviews.author: Tad Yenawine

customer_reviews.title: Great economical fan, does the job, well pleased with performance
customer_reviews.text: Wall control works great, a little bulky, but it’s out in the garage, fan turns up plenty of rpm, moves a lot of air. Does make a swishing sound from the blades moving so fast. Perfect for application
customer_reviews.author: Stormy NAME_NOT_RETURNED

customer_reviews.title: Good air flow even with 16' ceilings
customer_reviews.text: I put 2 of these in my 2,200 sg ft warehouse with 16' ceilings. Use them all the time, both in winter to push heat down and in the summer to feel comfortable. Barely audible motors, only a slight woosh of air moving.
customer_reviews.author: Macaholic

customer_reviews.title: only for very high ceillings, be aware!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking they'll fit fine at my new home, not the case and the seller would not take them back. Be aware. These do not work on regular height ceilings, only if you have a very high one it could fit.
customer_reviews.author: EBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Fan has 5 speeds
customer_reviews.text: Replaces the ironton fan that is no longer made. No problems with hook up,has more fan speeds. It does have a motor hum and couldn't get the blades to balance. It did list as used, just my luck.
customer_reviews.author: Wheelman

customer_reviews.title: SUPER RELIABLE ! QUIET AND POWERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my business. 5 YEARS, 24 HRS A DAY ZERO ISSUES !!! I wish it did the reverse spinning but too much to ask... GREAT BUY !
customer_reviews.author: Big-E

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Quiet. Wall speed controller is great
customer_reviews.text: Great looking. Sturdy material and construction. Easy to install. The wall speed controller is super useful. I bought two fans for a cabin porch. It is quiet compared to other units
customer_reviews.author: Jinav81

customer_reviews.title: Nice fan.
customer_reviews.text: Didnt want a light kit in the shop, just something to move the air around in when the heater is on or in the summer. Nice industrial look too. Comes with its own speed control.
customer_reviews.author: Cigar Smoke

customer_reviews.title: Great fan but need to make adjustments
customer_reviews.text: Great fan so far. Lots of air movement even on the lowest setting. It is fairly quiet. Looks great. We bought a a separate controller that fit into the light switch plate at OSH so we didn't have to use the ginormous box that came with it. If you do not have tall ceilings (ours are 8.5'), you will have to cut the metal post that makes it hang one foot lower than the ceiling height so you don't hurt anyone. We cut the post about 6 inches and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: kara

customer_reviews.title: Holy Control-Box.
customer_reviews.text: The fan looks fine. Haven’t installed yet so can’t comment on the ease of installation or the noise- but holy cow- this control box looks like it is straight out of 1987. It is the biggest, heaviest, most outdated control I have seen is at least 30 years- I can’t even believe this is still manufactured. I bought this for our beach house, which we are only at very part-time, so didn’t even open the box during the timeframe that I could have returned it, so I’m stuck with it- and it’s control box.
customer_reviews.author: Molly H.

customer_reviews.title: Great air circulation, will see on durability..
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for air circulation in our barn. Have been operating almost daily. One wobbles a bit in its housing (ball in socket). We have slight pitch on roof, so the ball in socket style keeps from having to buy adapter. The variable speed is nice feature too. They do excellent job as far as amount of air movement. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: MMR

customer_reviews.title: It might not last long.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sleek look and how it just blends with my ceiling. I don’t like that it began to slow down after about a year. Now the highest level is like having it on low.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene’s wish list

customer_reviews.title: Great for my garage.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Buy a better controller, it's worth the extra money. Fan moves a good amount of air. Does have some chop noise at high speeds but you're buying a 3 blade metal fan, not a 5 blade wooden one, so hence the "industrial" fan description
customer_reviews.author: Jill and Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, and well built fan for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought five of these for a high (20') shop ceiling, and as the documentation states, do not use these where someone can easily reach them. These are well built fans, and they are very heavy for a fan. The build quality seems to surpass its price, but as others mentioned, the included wall control is ugly! I ordered two 5A Cooper Wiring Devices 9543SG Aspire Fully Variable Fan Controls from Amazon, and they work, and look, great. If I had need for more high bay fans, I wouldn't hesitate to buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: akjm

customer_reviews.title: Still completely satisfied with fan after 5yrs
customer_reviews.text: Ive had 2 of these bad boys since 8/4/2013 and they still work perfectly. They are on my covered back porch. After 5years of moisture they need to be sanded and painted due to the paint is peeling on the top side of the blades(normal people wouldn’t notice) but im very very satisfied with this product and if anything happened to these i would definitely purchase agian!!
customer_reviews.author: John Janes

customer_reviews.title: Ceiling fan perfect for garage
customer_reviews.text: This ceiling fan is perfect for our garage. It looks nice and easily installed. Wanted for air circulation. Remote a plus. Highly recommend. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Reist

customer_reviews.title: piss poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: When I received the product, I found that the fan blades had a slight and very noticeable crosswise bend to them with a noticeable crease. This means that the packaging was very poor. Also the fan support pipe was too long and the company doesn't make it easy to modify to a certain length so it a bit of time to modify the length and drill out new holes for the mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Matt E. Cakes

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and moves a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my workshop with high ceilings. On high, it moves a lot of air and definitely helps the space feel cooler. It's also quite balanced and fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: eyesonlybob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outside
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our back porch and it’s great! Easy to install and has many different settings. However, level one keeps the flies away without blowing us away!
customer_reviews.author: Misty Fields

customer_reviews.title: Great fans for our patio
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It seems that there are two versions. One had flat blades one has curved edges. The curved one is slightly quieter. We put them on our patio because our misters ruin the blades on regular fans. So far they are working great. Plenty of air output.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought three for the high ceiling ares in home.Just as nice as we thought they would look/work.People comment on how sleek and "modern" they appear. Very happy with purchase.Also very efficient at moving air..Here,in S.Florida we find fans a necessity for cooling,along with their ambiance.Of course, the price is great as well....
customer_reviews.author: ed ches.

customer_reviews.title: Industrial looking fan looks fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Fan is nice looking. Wall mount controller is ugly, old fashioned, and doesn't match -- although it does have 10 different speeds. Instructions are easy if you've put up fans before, but did not quite match the model delivered. - Instruction mention blue wire (maybe for light), but this fan does not have. - It is easier to assemble the fan on the ground, and then put it up. Instructions do it the opposite way. - Instructions mention a short "post" for hanging fan, but that didn't come in the box. Looks great, though!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Hangs to low
customer_reviews.text: The bar to the fan is to long and makes the fan hang to low, for a normal ceiling. Plus it shakes a lot...and looks cheap. I don’t Reccomed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Really puts out the air
customer_reviews.text: This is an industrial fan but I put it in my home and it works great. Been using much less air conditioning and I intend to order another fax for my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: barbara patton

customer_reviews.title: No air flow at all outdoors.
customer_reviews.text: Bought three for outside air flow on our patio and carport. No air flow at all. I’m very disappointed to say the least on how much money was invested in these.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Loud!! But nice looking.
customer_reviews.text: These hum pretty loud and the air across the blades is VERY loud in speeds 3-5. They don’t seem to move an excessive amount of air either. These look great though!! Nice quality finish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’m a fan of this fan
customer_reviews.text: Good construction to last outside, fast speed and food wind. Too bad it doesn’t have a light. Remote control is convenient to avoid pull strings that rust in the elements.
customer_reviews.author: MARC E DUPUY JR

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately the cost savings was not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the cost savings was not worth it. Looks great but it wobbles like crazy and it's rather loud on anything but the lowest setting. Very disappointed. I should have listened to the negative reviewers. I am going to let it run for a while to see if it corrects itself.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L

customer_reviews.title: Put it in my beach house living room, and love it!
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is meant for an industrial environment, I put it in the living room of my beach house. It produces fantastic airflow, and I couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Y

customer_reviews.title: Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Just remember, you get what you pay for. This unit works just fine in my deck. It wobbles a good bit. I followed instructions and swapped out the blades and still wobbles. Not enough that I would return the unit, but a good bit. I weighed the blades and the weights are within 0.01g of each other, so I can't determine the source of the wobble, but overall, the unit looks great and moves a decent amount of air.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 3 only one worked
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back 2 times something was bad in the motor will not get another. Amazon was good to work with to return the fans.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Oklahoma

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, puts out a ton of speed
customer_reviews.text: Great fan, puts out a ton of speed. I highly recommend that you purchase (separately) Westinghouse fan wall control. As other reviews have mentioned the one that is included with this fan, is comical. Even my electrician had a good laugh looking at how out dated and Huge it was. Overall, great fan for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: James & Melissa

customer_reviews.title: No flush mount option....
customer_reviews.text: This fan has no option for flush mounting to a ceiling. The room I bought this for has an 8ft ceiling and since I am 6ft I hit my head on it. It works ok, but it is not ideal. If it had an option to be flush mounted I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but very close, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty solid fan. No installation issues, only a slight wobble on the highest speeds, which could be due to the fact that I shortened the downrod and the holes I drilled probably aren't perfect. As everyone has stated, the control looks like it belongs on the set of LOST. I opted for a Lutron TGFSQ-FH-WH and it works great. Can't beat the price, especially through amazon warehouse deals.
customer_reviews.author: D. Troyer

customer_reviews.title: Bought three (3) for our Laundromat - work GREAT - really move the air
customer_reviews.text: Bought three (3) for our Laundromat - work GREAT - really move the air. Installation with without a hitch and all worked as advertised. We have 14' ceilings and needed a powerful fan; these fit the bill. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mullican

customer_reviews.title: Best industrial fan that we ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Wired without the remote. Installed a different reostat switch for speed control. Quite and moves a crapload of air. Purchased 10 of these for our work shop and cut the heat bill way down. Great value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Ray Drazen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fan. Installed ours outside over the patio table
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fan. Installed ours outside over the patio table. Works great ! 5 fan speed, easy to install. Not sure if you can install without the down rod. My only complaint is that my control knob for the fan speed box will not work. The piece the knob slides onto looks worn. I am currently using a pair of pliers to turn the fan on. Just installed so I will contact Westinghouse to see if they can help . I'll post an update about Westinghouse customer service .
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and quiet. Full speed kicks out the wind!
customer_reviews.text: Sleek and modern. Beautiful fan. Quiet on lower speeds fastest speed cranks it and it sounds like it. No grinding noise. They look like airplane propellers and feel like them too! I recommend leaving the plastic on each blade while you screw the blade to the housing. This way there are no finger smudges when you're done installing. We used a 24" long 1/2" diameter downrod to fit our cathedral. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: JeffJeffYY

customer_reviews.title: Good fan
customer_reviews.text: Very good fan for the money. It moves air very well. It does not have a reverse polarity option ,I reall wish it did.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Looks great - comes with a mounted control
customer_reviews.text: We are really happy with the fan, it has exactly the look I wanted (which was hard to find). It looks exactly as it did in the pictures. My only criticism is it comes with a control box that is to be mounted on the wall. The box is not attractive and seems cumbersome for how things are made these days. Instead, we installed a switch with a control on the side. I suspect you could also connect it to a dimmer switch. Also, when on high it really does whip up some air and gives off a whirring sound like a plane or helicopter blade. But no one should need to run a fan that high!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, Cheap but it is metal, so its ok
customer_reviews.text: The controller looks like it was designed by a 1980s engineer. Why cant they update it??? It is a great shop fan, does move decent amount of air
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K King

product_meta.title: Westinghouse Lighting Westinghouse 7861400 Industrial 56-Inch Three Indoor Ceiling Fan, Brushed Nickel Steel Blades
product_meta.description: Color:Brushed NickelThe durable Westinghouse Industrial 56-Inch Three-Blade Indoor Ceiling Fan is designed for commercial, industrial or larger residential spaces. Well-recognized for its modern, mechanical appeal, the Industrial fan has a sleek brushed nickel finish, needs minimal assembly and includes a five-speed wall control unit. Perfect for workshops, high ceiling great rooms, two-story entryways and lofts.
feature_bullets: Indoor 56 inch ceiling fan, down rod only installation ideal for great rooms up to 400 square feet
Brushed nickel ceiling fan with three brushed nickel steel blades
Westinghouse ceiling fans feature a high-quality motor, deliver powerful air movement and quiet performance, wall control ceiling fan offers easy operation of 5 speed on/off fan control
Fan Performance on High Speed Airflow: 5370 CFM, Energy Usage: 69 W without lights, Airflow Efficiency: 78 CFM/W
15 year limited motor warranty and two-year warranty on all other parts

specifications.Included Components: Five-Speed Wall Control, Ball hanger installation system., 12-Inch Length By 1/2-Inch Diameter Down Rod, 78-Inch Lead Wire, Ball Hanger Installation System, Industrial Indoor Ceiling Fan
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,370 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
